name: Prince Hall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just had our first visit to Prince Hall for our 30th Wedding Anniversary with our 2 "fur children" (Lola-Spaniel and Josh -Collie). The room was fantastic, the bed and duvet were amazing and the food !! Where do I begin-it was a real treat to try some flavours I had not experienced before. The canapes and Amouse bouche were great and then the 3 course dinner was superb. Not forgetting breakfast of such a high quality with local produce. Even homemade brown and tomato sauce with breakfast !! Only downside was fog/cloud giving poor visibility to what I am sure would of been a spectacular view of Houndtor and the surrounding moors-but that is what you can get if staying on moorland. Good dog walks locally and plenty of biscuits in room.
reviews.title: Doggy Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We had a kid free weekend and booked into The Prince Hall Hotel. We live in devon but felt like we were a million miles from away peaceful and relaxing. Staff very friendly and very welcoming, room very homely and fab views. Food was really good too.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend to others and would return and stay again
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for a lovely weekend
reviews.title: Relaxing, dog friendly and wonderful food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Prince Hall, and we will definitely go again. The staff were welcoming, friendly yet very efficient. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Only things lacking in the bathroom were a large towel rail and hooks on the back of the bathroom door. The food was excellent and the dog was thoroughly spoilt. Great location for walkers, from the hotel, or going further afield.
reviews.title: Perfect for Dog owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small Country House Hotel where the staff do their best you make you feel welcome, comfortable and at home.
reviews.title: Small and Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms that I have stayed in (on two visits) were spacious and delighful.
reviews.title: Quiet and understated luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is absolutely excellent.
reviews.title: Welcoming and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And if you bring your dogs they are very welcome and greeted as well as you are.
reviews.title: a fantastic first stay at Prince Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did I mention the food ? Superb.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned to Prince Hall for 3 nights, having had a great stay earlier in the year. I am pleased to say it was all just as wonderful..........room, food, service and general ambiance. Our 2 labradors were with us and my wife and I agree, this is the most dog friendly hotel we know. Thank you to all the team for a totally relaxed time, we will definately be back !
reviews.title: Wonderful return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: I stayed here for my birthday evening, and could not fault it in the slightest !, the ambiance is just perfect and the location beautifull.
reviews.title: 25th birthday stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal was out of yhis world huge credit to the chef in the kitchen attention to detail is second to none from the appitizers in the lounge to the cheese platter in the bar perfect finish to a lovely meal !!
reviews.title: Spectacular food! (And views of course)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are large, warm and very spacious with views over the moors absolutle luxury in every form !
reviews.title: Haven of Peace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast again faultless very satisfying with lots of options to choose from.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you love dogs, and you love nature in the raw, then this is the perfect hotel. Idyllically situated right in the centre of Dartmoor and with stunning views Prince Hall is the perfect place to stay with your dog and feel pampered and looked after.
reviews.title: Perfect for nature loving dog owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small and very comfortable hotel with comfortable lounges and superb almost Michelin star quality food. From the front door you can walk up onto the moors. There is a stunning circular walk of 9-10 miles that takes in the moors, the rivers, an ancient wood, and much more. It took us 6 hours to do this walk; a perfect day out followed by a superb cream tea back at the hotel with giant freshly baked scones and the best raspberry jam I have ever tasted.
reviews.title: Wonderful and great for dog lovers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only criticism of Prince Hall is that there were no bath robes in the ensuite. We will definitely be back,
reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel for Dogs and Guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: A really great hotel and in a beautiful spot. We stayed for two nights and would have liked to have stayed longer. Dinner was fabulous. They are so welcoming of dogs and would highly recommend it if you want to bring your furry friend along. Lots to do in Dartmoor if you like the outdoors and walking.
reviews.title: A lovely night away with elderly grandparents and their yorkie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: We visited Prince Hall over the May Bank Holiday. It was our first time visiting the hotel and Dartmoor and we hugely impressed with the service, location, and food. Prince Hall is positioned in the heart of Dartmoor, more sheep than cars and it is peaceful, quite and serene. Our room had a view of the Moors that was incredibly and the room was large and quite comfortable. We werent planning on taking all our meals at the hotel, but enjoyed the food so much we ended up eathing in the resturant every night. The best thing though was how kind and wonderful the staff are. The locaton and hotel is upscale without being snobbish. Our dogs were welcomed with open arms and we loved having a cup of tea in the bar with our pets. The open space makes it a great location for dogs to roam free and even though our older dog who has arthirtis had no issues walking on the paths. I would recommend Prince Hall has an excellent place for pets, people and relaxing. We look forward to another "family" visit to this great hotel.
reviews.title: A complete gem.. A food and dog lovers dream location

aka: Prince Hall Hotel Two Bridges, Dartmoor National Park
description: Prince Hall Country House Hotel is set in the very heart of Dartmoor National Park with its breath-taking scenery. Hands-on owners Fi & Chris Daly, with their staff, are dedicated to offering you exceptional comfort, hospitality and cuisine in a uniquely tranquil and secluded setting. Well-behaved dogs are very welcome, at no extra charge. The hotel is open to non residents for morning coffee, light lunches, afternoon teas and dinner.
